required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Verification of Biomarkers to Examine Neonatal Asphyxia-induced Hypoxic-ischemic Encephalopathy Study on Neuro-developmental Follow-up at 2 Years A Prospective Multicenter Observational Study for Development of a Diagnostic Test

brief_summary.textblock: Follow-up of participants of AAMBI1 study at age of at least 2 years. AAMBI1(ClinicalTrials.gov ID: NCT03354208): Verification of biomarkers in a human population for their ability to diagnose the severity of neonatal asphyxia. These biomarkers linked to asphyxia have been identified in animal studies.

detailed_description.textblock: Follow-Up on neuro-developmental status of Study participants of AAMBI1. AAMBI1(ClinicalTrials.gov ID: NCT03354208): The aim of the study is to verify the application of combinations of several laboratory parameters in early postnatal blood samples, for identification of infants, who will suffer from early abnormal neonatal neurological outcome, in a population at risk. The population at risk is defined as term and late preterm (>36 weeks of gestation) human infants following perinatal hypoxia-ischemia with or without postnatal resuscitation.

primary_outcome.description: All infants with normal neuro-developmental status

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with potentially abnormal neuro-developmental status
primary_outcome.description: All infants who do not fulfill outcomes 1, 3 or 4

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with abnormal neuro-developmental status - HIE
primary_outcome.description: Presence of adverse 2 years neuro-developmental outcome likely attributable to perinatal hypoxic-ischemic brain injury

primary_outcome.measure: Participants with abnormal neuro-developmental status - non-HIE
primary_outcome.description: Presence of adverse 2 years neuro-developmental Outcome not attributable to perinatal hypoxic-ischemic brain injury

study_pop.textblock: Children, who had been enrolled in the AAMBI study immediately after birth because they had been suspected to be at risk for perinatal brain injury (hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy, HIE) and/or evaluated for hypothermia therapy or because they had been enrolled in AAMBI as healthy controls (with adaptation disorder only).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants previously enrolled in the AAMBI1 study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Missing valid written informed parental consent
